name: Odin
description: Watch your head. This rocket-mounted firework explodes at a maximum height of 300 feet, bursting in iridescent huges of teal, purple and orange. Recommended use over a large body of water.

name: Ifrit
description: A dragon's tongue is forked; so is Ifrit's. This display reproduces plumes of fire from a dragon's molten lungs in dual displays of red and orange pyrotechnics. Explodes at a maximum height of 200 feet.

name: Shiva
description: Shiva's icy veins explode in this cascading, willow-like firework that lingers in the sky for up to 30 seconds after detonation.

name: Neo Bahamut
description: A bigger version of its sibling, Bahamut, Neo Bahamut renders a single yellow spire after detonation. As the ordnance falls, it increases in vibrance, illuminating the sky. Do not use with other ordnances.

name: Knights of the Round
description: Consider the roman candle as a cannon. Knights fires successive ordnances up to 400 feet, each exploding in six distinct pyrotechnic patterns.
